JumpScale.baselib.tags package¶

Submodules¶

JumpScale.baselib.tags.Tags module¶

class JumpScale.baselib.tags.Tags.Tags(tagstring='', setFunction4Tagstring=None)[source]¶

represent set of tags & _labels label is e.g. important (no value attached) tag is with value attached e.g. customer:kristof

fromString(tagstring)[source]¶

go from string to Tag class filled in

@param tagstring: example “important customer:kristof” @type tagstring: string

getDict()[source]¶
getValues(**kwargs)[source]¶

for each item given as named argument check it is in the tags & and if not use it e.g. args=self.getValues(id=1,name=”test”) will return a dict with id & name and these values unless if they were set in the tags already

can further use it as follows: params.result=infomgr.getInfoWithHeaders(**args)

only return the ones which are specified as args

labelDelete(labelname)[source]¶

delete label, raise error if not existing

@param labelname: e.g important @type labelname: string

labelExists(labelname)[source]¶

check whether labelname exists in the labels

@return: true if label exists @rtype: boolean

labelSet(labelName)[source]¶

add new label

@param labelName: e.g important @type labelName: string

tagCheckValue(tagname, value)[source]¶

check if specified tag is equal to value

tagDelete(tagname)[source]¶

delete tag, raise error if not existing

@param tagname: e.g customer @type tagname: string

tagExists(tagname)[source]¶

check whether tagname exists in the tags dictionary

@return: true if tag exists @rtype: boolean

tagGet(tagname, default=None)[source]¶

@param tagname: e.g customer @type tagname: string

@return: value behind tag @rtype: string

tagSet(tagName, tagValue)[source]¶

add new key value tag

@param tagName: e.g customer @type tagName: string

@param tagValue: e.g kristof @type tagValue: string

JumpScale.baselib.tags.TagsFactory module¶

class JumpScale.baselib.tags.TagsFactory.TagsFactory[source]¶

Bases: object

Factory Class of dealing with TAGS

getObject(tagstring='', setFunction4Tagstring=None)[source]¶

check whether labelname exists in the labels

@param tagstring: example “important customer:kristof” @type tagstring: string

getTagString(labels=None, tags=None)[source]¶

Return a valid tags string, it’s recommended to use this function and not to build the script manually to skip reserved letters.

@param labels: A set of labels @param tags: A dict with key values
